title.narrative: OUTPUT 17: DECENTRALIZED PLANNING AND MONITORING

description.narrative: Improved capacity for decentralized planning and monitoring for results in basic education., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more girls and boys in Ghana are supported to complete quality and inclusive basic education with improved learning outcomes

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved capacity for decentralized planning and monitoring for results in basic education.

description.narrative: UNICEF support to GES structure, which forms part of MoE’s effort to reform the education sector has enabled the development of the Annual District Education Operation Plans (ADEOP), using the new ADEOP template, which incorporates planning for emergencies such as natural disasters and COVID-19 that affects education delivery in Ghana. National/Master trainers equipped to cascade mSRC upgraded content training across the country, and to deploy the application for real time data collection, analysis and taking school/district level decisions. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/12/2021
